meanings.sent1: After a long period of neglect, she decided to respiritualize her daily meditation practice.
meanings.sent2: The old temple was in ruins, but the community came together to respiritualize it with love and care.
meanings.sent3: Trying to respiritualize a broken smartphone won't bring it back to life!
meanings.sent4: The artist sought to respiritualize the abandoned church through his breathtaking murals.
meanings.sent5: The gentle rain seemed to respiritualize the parched earth, bringing new life to the land.

meanings.definition: To infuse with spiritual qualities once more.
meanings.sent1: The retreat aimed to respiritualize the participants, helping them find inner peace.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ritual was performed to respiritualize the sacred artifact.
meanings.sent3: She tried to respiritualize her morning routine by adding calming music.
meanings.sent4: The wise words of the monk seemed to respiritualize the troubled soul.
meanings.sent5: The scent of incense filled the room, helping to respiritualize the atmosphere for meditation.
